intro: Tripterygium bullockii, commonly known as the Chinese thunder god vine, is a perennial shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that give way to orange-red berries. It contains various bioactive compounds, including tripterygium acid, which has been studied for its medicinal properties. Due to its toxic nature, it is often used in traditional medicine with caution.
